entry.title: Fashion's greatest hits, misses on the Cannes red carpet
entry.summary: Cannes' red carpet can be as kind as it is cruel when it comes to fashion.

entry.title: Fashion's greatest hits, misses on the Cannes red carpet
entry.summary: Jury member Miller had a cinematic comeback this year - after roles in "American Sniper" and "Foxcatcher" - but it was an off year for her on the Cannes red carpet.

entry.title: Fashion's greatest hits, misses on the Cannes red carpet
entry.summary: Here are the 68th Cannes Film Festival's fashion hits and misses.

entry.title: The movies that will keep buzzing after Cannes
entry.summary: It was a the kind of Cote d'Azur tempest that often overtakes Cannes, especially because the prevailing theme of this year's festival was female equality in film " the kind of roles thrust to the center of movies and the people directing them.

entry.title: The movies that will keep buzzing after Cannes
The movies that will keep buzzing after Cannes
entry.summary:
CANNES, France (AP) - The Cannes Film Festival is a grand hierarchy with strictly defined elevations of movies and media access, where films are met by high praise or lowly boos.

And so there was a strange fittingness that the scandal of the 68th Cannes Film Festival, where all status is measured, came down to the importance of a few inches.

entry.title: France touts Cannes prizes as vindication for film subsidies
entry.summary:
PARIS (AP) - France's president says his country's strong showing at this year's Cannes film festival is no accident - suggesting it's partly thanks to government subsidies.

France has had long dry spells without prizes at Cannes.

entry.title: Audiard's 'Dheepan' wins Palme d'Or in upset Cannes finale
entry.summary: The Camera d'Or, Cannes award for best first feature film, went to "La Tierra Y la Sombra."

entry.title: Audiard's 'Dheepan' wins Palme d'Or in upset Cannes finale
entry.summary: Lindon's award added to a banner year at Cannes for France, which had five films out of the 19 in competition and went home with three awards.

entry.title: France wins big, Italy, Blanchett lose out in Cannes
entry.summary:
"I'm very moved. Winning a prize from the Coen brothers is something that is exceptional," Audiard, who has won two smaller Cannes awards in the past, told the closing ceremony.

Scott Roxborough, a critic for the trade publication The Hollywood Reporter, said Audiard had been in the running for a Cannes award for a long time.

entry.title: Sri Lankan refugee film ?Dheepan? takes Cannes? top prize
entry.summary: CANNES, France - The 68th Cannes Film Festival was brought to a surprising close Sunday with Jacques Audiard's Sri Lankan refugee film taking the festival's coveted top honor, the Palme d'Or.

entry.title: Refugee drama 'Dheepan' named best film at Cannes
French film 'Dheepan' wins top Palme d'Or award in Cannes
entry.summary: Director Jacques Audiard, Palme d'Or award winner for his film ''Dheepan'', delivers a speech on stage during the closing ceremony of the 68th Cannes Film Festival in Cannes, southern France, May 24, 2015.

entry.title: Cannes Film Festival: Dheepan wins Palme d'Or
entry.summary: Jacques Audiard's immigrant drama Dheepan has won the Palme d'Or, the top honour of the Cannes Film Festival.

entry.title: Audiard's 'Dheepan' wins Palme d'Or in upset Cannes finale
entry.summary: The others on the Cannes jury were: Guillermo del Toro, Jake Gyllenhaal, Sienna Miller, Sophie Marceau, Xavier Dolan, Rokia Traore and Rossy de Palma.

entry.title: 60th birthday for Cannes' Palme d'Or top film trophy
entry.summary: A person poses for a photograph with a box containing the Palme d'Or award, which will be presented on Sunday, at the 68th international film festival, Cannes, southern France, Saturday, May 23, 2015.

entry.title: 60th birthday for Cannes' Palme d'Or top film trophy
At Cannes, Michel Franco's 'Chronic' looks death in the face
entry.summary:
The Mexican filmmaker's Cannes Film Festival entry "Chronic" stars Tim Roth as a homecare nurse to the dying.

"When I watch a film, the minute I sense that I am being manipulated, I step back," Franco said at a Cannes hotel poolside.

The actor and director met at Cannes in 2012, when a jury headed by Roth awarded a prize to Franco's "After Lucia."

entry.title: At Cannes, Michel Franco's 'Chronic' looks death in the face
entry.summary: CANNES, France (AP) - Death is something we'd all like to avoid.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Going out In style
entry.summary: The Oscar-winner, who's known for her fashion-forward style, bucked the trend for classical va-va-voom and voluminous dresses that have been popular during this year's Cannes Film Festival.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Going out In style
CANNES WATCH: Going out In style
entry.summary: Marion Cotillard plays a queen in Justin Kurzel's "Macbeth," but at its Cannes premiere she was also a bejeweled queen of the red carpet.

entry.title: Palme d'Or up for grabs ahead of Cannes Film Festival finale
Powerful Cannes film 'Mediterranea' humanizes migrants
Icelandic film 'Rams' wins Cannes Un Certain Regard prize
entry.summary: CANNES, France (AP) - "Rams," a drama set among farmers and their sheep in a remote Icelandic valley, won the Cannes Film Festival's Un Certain Regard competition on Saturday.

entry.title: Sensation of 'Dope' continues at Cannes Film Festival
entry.summary:
CANNES, France (AP) - A year ago, writer-director Rick Famuyiwa was struggling to find financing for his film after studios in Hollywood passed on it.

"Dope" premiered Friday in the Cannes Film Festival's Directors' Fortnight section with most of its young cast enthusiastically in tow.

entry.title: Sensation of 'Dope' continues at Cannes Film Festival
entry.summary: Now, he's sitting in a restaurant at Cannes riding the sensation of "Dope," his comic Los Angeles coming-of-age tale that sparked a bidding war this year at the Sundance Film Festival.

entry.title: Cannes hails premiere of a bloody, stylish 'Macbeth'
entry.summary:
Cannes hailed the premiere of the Australian director's interpretation of the Shakespeare tragedy, the final film to screen in competition at the festival, which concludes Sunday.

The film, among the most eagerly awaited at Cannes, is a grimly visceral adaptation of "Macbeth," shot partly in Scotland, striking in the bleak beauty of its earthy violence.

entry.title: Cannes hails premiere of a bloody, stylish 'Macbeth'
entry.summary: CANNES, France (AP) - Something wicked came the way of the Cannes Film Festival on Saturday when Justin Kurzel premiered his bloody, stylish adaptation of "Macbeth" with Michael Fassbender and Marion Cotillard.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Toni Garrn sparkles in silver on red carpet
CANNES WATCH: 'Arabian Nights' canine named Cannes' top dog
entry.summary: An unofficial part of the Cannes Film Festival, the Palm Dog was founded in 2001 and is judged by a panel of film critics.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: 'Arabian Nights' canine named Cannes' top dog
entry.summary:
CANNES, France (AP) - A small white dog named Lucky has taken the award for Cannes' best performance on four legs.

Its name is a play on Cannes' top film prize, the Palme d'Or.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Longoria a success behind the camera
entry.summary:
There's been much talk at the Cannes Film Festival about how to boost the ranks of women directors and producers.

Longoria, who is in Cannes in part as an ambassador for L'Oreal, said the new digital age of TV, and various streaming services are helping to improve diversity in Hollywood.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Karlie Kloss stuns, Andie MacDowell reveals
entry.summary:
And a film honoring designer Oscar de la Renta showed that he may be gone, but his influence at Cannes is still strong.

Kloss has been consistently dazzling during the Cannes Film Festival since it began last week, including a standout Oscar de la Renta powder blue embellished mermaid gown at the glitzy de Grisogono party earlier this week.

entry.title: Gaspar Noe's explicit 'Love' sets Cannes atwitter
entry.summary:
CANNES, France (AP) - The movies are in love with love, but they're often squeamish about sex.

That's not something that can be said about director Gaspar Noe, whose new film "Love" brings graphic sex - in myriad positions and permutations, in twosomes, threesomes and groups - to the Cannes Film Festival.

"Love" was - unsurprisingly - one of the most anticipated films at Cannes, where it is playing as an out-of-competition entry.

entry.title: Red carpet Emergency Room at Cannes is always full of drama
entry.summary: That happened to Cannes best actress winner Berenice Bejo, star of "The Artist," who in 2013 had to be flown in at the eleventh hour from Paris.

entry.title: Red carpet Emergency Room at Cannes is always full of drama
entry.summary:
CANNES, France (AP) - For most of the year, room 331 of the Martinez Hotel is just your run-of-the mill luxury five star hotel suite.

That is especially the case for members of the Cannes jury, who are holed up in a bunker before the awards ceremony, sequestered from the press.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Andie MacDowell speaks on her Cannes regret
entry.summary:
CANNES, France (AP) - Andie MacDowell's has great memories of the Cannes Film Festival, but also one big regret - the year she decided to skip it.

MacDowell, who stars in the Hallmark television series "Cedar Cove" and is in this summer's "Magic Mike XXL," was in Cannes as a brand ambassador for L'Oreal.

entry.title: Cannes film pays homage to late designer Oscar de la Renta
entry.summary: The spirit of Oscar de la Renta lives on every day at the Cannes Film Festival.

entry.title: Cannes film pays homage to late designer Oscar de la Renta
entry.summary: Now a documentary film has been screened at Cannes, called "Ovation for Oscar," paying homage to his work.

entry.title: Cannes film pays homage to late designer Oscar de la Renta
entry.summary: Documentary film pays homage to the late Oscar de la Renta at the 68th international Cannes Film Festival.

entry.title: 3D sex movie shocks Cannes
entry.summary: THE CANNES Film Festival got its first taste of full-blown controversy after a late-night session with director Gaspar Noe's hyper-sexual 3D tale Love.

entry.title: Cannes: Amputee Stopped 'For Not Wearing Heels'
entry.summary: Ms Richter, who was eventually allowed in, spoke after Cannes was accused of turning away women in flat shoes.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: A mermaid dress and wedding bells for Brolin
entry.summary: "In the mid-1990s, there were a lot of discos popping up in China," the 45-year-old director told reporters Wednesday in Cannes, where his film is competing for the Palme d'Or.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: A mermaid dress and wedding bells for Brolin
entry.summary: Romanian model-turned-actress Madalina Ghenea had already grabbed attention at the Cannes Film Festival by featuring nude on the provocative poster for the film "Youth."

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: A mermaid dress and wedding bells for Brolin
entry.summary:
CANNES, France (AP) - Cannes is by the water so it was only appropriate that the film festival on Wednesday celebrated a stunning mermaid dress.

Josh Brolin used the Cannes Film Festival not only as an opportunity to promote his new film, but to reveal his new fiancee.

entry.title: Josh Brolin attends Cannes premiere with new fianc?e Kathryn
entry.summary: Brolin has been promoting his latest film at Cannes, Denis Villeneuve's drug cartel drama "Sicario," with co-stars Emily Blunt and Benicio Del Toro.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Lasseter shows Pixar, Disney animation slate
entry.summary: The Pixar and Disney Animation chief creative officer presented footage to a Cannes Film Festival audience of Pixar's delayed movie "The Good Dinosaur," which he called the studio's biggest "What if?"

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Lasseter shows Pixar, Disney animation slate
entry.summary: "Moana" appeared to bear out Lasseter's recent proclamation at Cannes that Pixar and Disney are interested in having more female and ethnic protagonists.

entry.title: Cannes red carpet dance is a tightly controlled choreography
entry.summary: And yet not everyone is so bowled over by the Cannes red carpet.

entry.title: Michael Caine has press in fits of laughter in Cannes
entry.summary: Actors Michael Caine, left, and Rachel Weisz arrive for a press conference for the film Youth at the 68th international film festival, Cannes, southern France, Wednesday, May 20, 2015.

entry.title: Digital upstarts upend tradition at Cannes Film Festival
entry.summary:
The market at the Cannes Film Festival, where international movie rights are bought and sold, has long been a bastion of the old-school film industry.

On Tuesday, Netflix sent a signal about its growing clout when it acquired the Kevin James' movie "The True Memoirs of an International Assassin," its first major original-film buy at Cannes.

entry.title: Hollywood sex abuse documentary screens in Cannes
entry.summary:
A dark side of the movie world has played out onscreen at Cannes in "An Open Secret," a documentary about child sexual abuse that calls itself "the movie Hollywood doesn't want you to see."

It focuses on a handful of victims who were willing to speak on camera, but former Olympic diving champion Greg Louganis, who is in Cannes to support the movie, said this is "the tip of the iceberg in Hollywood."

entry.title: "Sicario" with Emily Blunt as FBI agent brings drug wars to Cannes
Cannes steps into trouble with high-heels dress code
Celebrity charity rally roars past Cannes finish line
entry.summary: The celebrity charity car rally "Cash & Rocket" roared into Cannes Tuesday, with its band of stars that this year included actress Michelle Rodriguez, model Jodie Kidd and singer Natalie Imbruglia.

entry.title: Celebrity charity rally roars past Cannes finish line
entry.summary: The rally began in Paris, and went on to Lyon and Milan to arrive at the finish line in Cannes " 1,067 Miles (1,717 km) and five days later.

entry.title: Weisz, Blunt, Huppert discuss gender inequality at Cannes party
entry.summary: Cast member Emily Blunt poses during a photocall for the film 'Sicario' in competition at the 68th Cannes Film Festival in Cannes, southern France, May 19, 2015.

entry.title: Cannes steps into trouble with high-heels dress code
entry.summary: "There is no specific mention about the height of the women's heels as well as for men's," Aime said of Cannes' dress code.

entry.title: Cannes steps into trouble with high-heels dress code
entry.summary: The Cannes Film Festival is coming under scrutiny for its strict dress code after women not wearing high heels were turned away from a premiere.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Star-studded Calvin Klein event honors women
entry.summary: "You'll have a hit movie that women are at the forefront of and people are like 'Oh, it's all changing.' And then I feel like it resorts back to what it was before ... But I do feel that things are changing," said Blunt, who stars in "Sicario," one of the 19 films competing this year for Cannes' top prize.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Star-studded Calvin Klein event honors women
entry.summary: Others, like jury member Sienna Miller, used the evening to express how the experience of the Cannes Film Festival has affected them.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Star-studded Calvin Klein event honors women
entry.summary: CANNES (AP) - The star-studded Calvin Klein Women in Film soiree could not have come at a more appropriate moment - at a Cannes Film Festival where the dearth of women directors has been a major theme.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: DiCaprio buys $13,600 bag for charity
entry.summary: CANNES, France (AP) - Who knew Leonardo DiCaprio had an eye for Chanel bags?

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Star-studded Calvin Klein event honors women
entry.summary: Melanie Laurent poses for photographers upon arrival at the Calvin Klein Women in Film party at the 68th international film festival, Cannes, southern France, Monday, May 18, 2015.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Andie's glow, Colin's happily single, and more
Amy Poehler and Mindy Kaling in Cannes as they promote Pixar film Inside Out
After a Cannes drubbing, Van Sant reflects on 'Sea of Trees'
entry.summary:
CANNES, France (AP) - The full-throated passions of the Cannes Film Festival can elevate, just as they can humble.

Though its official red-carpet premiere on Saturday went down better, the Cannes fate of "The Sea of Trees" was already sealed as (at least thus far) the festival's most rudely received film.

"I was, as I always am, cautious," Van Sant said in an interview about showing "The Sea of Trees" at Cannes.

entry.title: At Cannes, Norway's Trier maps complex US family drama
entry.summary: The film, which is competing for the top prize at Cannes, the Palme d'Or, has an elaborate structure but a simple message: Families are complicated.

entry.title: At Cannes, Norway's Trier maps complex US family drama
entry.summary:
CANNES, France (AP) - Norwegian director Joachim Trier thinks the best qualities of American cinema have moved to TV - and he wants them back.

"When I was growing up, everyone's parents got divorced and suddenly came 'Kramer vs. Kramer' or 'Ordinary People, " he told reporters at a Cannes press conference Monday.

entry.title: At Cannes, Norway's Trier maps complex US family drama
CANNES WATCH: Andie MacDowell stuns in coral gown
entry.summary: CANNES (AP) - Proving that age is no barrier to beauty, a radiant Andie MacDowell went for some old-fashioned va-va-voom in an Elie Saab gown in coral on the Cannes red carpet.

entry.title: Pixar celebrates Cannes return with original 'Inside Out'
entry.summary:
After a two-year hiatus, Pixar has made a sensational return to the Cannes Film Festival with "Inside Out," the kind of fresh take on animation that the studio built itself on.

"Inside Out" premiered Monday at Cannes and was among the most enthusiastically received films of the festival.

The reception to "Inside Out" was so good that some at Cannes wondered whether it should have been included in the festival's prestigious Palme d'Or competition.

entry.title: Les femmes (and les blockbusters) are all the talk at Cannes
entry.summary:
This year's Cannes Film Festival is about halfway through, but one thing is already clear: This festival belongs to les femmes.

From the word go, this year's Cannes has been dominated by women and debate about gender equality in the movie industry.

Cannes, in its 68th festival, is in some ways an unlikely place for an explosion of attention to sexism.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Li Bing Bing says China's where the money's at
entry.summary: The trip to Cannes this year is a special one because Li made it a family affair.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Jeff Koons work to be auctioned off for charity
entry.summary:
Jeff Koons is about to generate some major cash for AIDS charity amfAR: He's agreed to auction off his massive "Coloring Book" sculpture for the group's annual gala outside Cannes this week.

Organizers at amfAR are hoping "Coloring Book" can generate similar numbers for its Thursday gala at Hotel du Cap-Eden-Roc, just outside of Cannes in d'Antibes.

The annual amfAR "Cinema Against AIDS" gala is the glitziest event during the Cannes Film Festival.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Colin Farrell happy to be single
CANNES WATCH: Colin Farrell happy to be single
entry.summary: CANNES, France (AP) - In his new sci-fi movie "The Lobster," Colin Farrell plays a single man desperate to get into a committed relationship or risk being transformed into an animal.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Portman eschews politics, Mara's fashion coup
entry.summary: Tom Ford's second film has been acquired by Focus Features in the biggest sale yet at Cannes.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Jane Fonda says gender pay gap 'unacceptable'
entry.summary: Fonda was celebrated by the Cannes Film Festival and luxury goods company Kering for her contribution to cinema Sunday as the first honoree of the "Women in Motion" program.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Jane Fonda says gender pay gap 'unacceptable'
entry.summary: CANNES, France (AP) - Jane Fonda is starring in a film at Cannes, but she also came to the film festival to pick up an honor.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Rooney Mara scores floaty white fashion coup
entry.summary: CANNES (AP) " Rooney Mara scored a fashion coup at the "Carol" premiere in a diaphanous white gown that upstaged her more famous co-star Cate Blanchett.

entry.title: CANNES TREND: It's all eyes on shoulders on red carpet
entry.summary: It's all eyes on shoulders at the Cannes Film Festival, with red-carpet stars ditching the bust in favor of accentuating the upper torso and shoulders - through embellishments or bare skin.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Portman says new Israeli isn't political
entry.summary:
CANNES, France (AP) - Natalie Portman's directorial debut, "A Tale of Love and Darkness," is set around the time of the formation of Israel, but the Oscar-winning actress says it doesn't have a political agenda.

The film, adapted from an autobiographical novel by Amos Oz, premiered over the weekend at the Cannes Film Festival.

Portman's film is playing as a special screening outside of the main competition at Cannes.

entry.title: The shellfish giant: 'The Lobster' makes a big Cannes splash
entry.summary: CANNES, France (AP) - Yorgos Lanthimos has people in Cannes imagining themselves as animals.

entry.title: The shellfish giant: 'The Lobster' makes a big Cannes splash
entry.summary: "The Lobster" has been gobbled up by Cannes critics and audiences.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Sylvester Stallone, the artiste, has a show
entry.summary: Sylvester Stallone, the artiste, eschews Cannes this year for his exhibit at the Museum of Modern and Contemporary Art in Nice.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Sylvester Stallone, the artiste, has a show
entry.summary: While the show is near Cannes, it wasn't intentional.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Sylvester Stallone, the artiste, has a show
entry.summary: NICE, France (AP) - Last year at the Cannes Film Festival, Sylvester Stallone and his merry band of musclemen were rumbling down the Croisette in tanks to promote their film "The Expendables 3."

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Jude Law to play fictional pope for HBO
entry.summary: CANNES, France (AP) " Jude Law is the new pope.

entry.title: Cannes swoons for 'Carol,' Todd Haynes' '50s lesbian romance
entry.summary: CANNES, France (AP) - Todd Haynes' 1950s lesbian romance "Carol," with Cate Blanchett and Rooney Mara, had the Cannes Film Festival swooning after its premiere.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: France's 'My King' is a roller-coaster romance
entry.summary:
CANNES, France (AP) - Relationship drama "My King" pairs Emmanuelle Bercot and Vincent Cassel, two of the busiest people in Cannes.

Directed by French actress-filmmaker Maiwenn, "My King" is a female take on relationships, in a year when the place of women in the film industry is being hotly debated at Cannes.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: France's 'My King' is a roller-coaster romance
entry.summary: He's also in two other royalty-themed Cannes entries, appearing as a lustful fairy-tale king in Matteo Garrone's "Tale of Tales" and lending his voice to animated "The Little Prince."

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Sylvester Stallone, the artiste, has a show
CANNES WATCH: Natalie Portman dazzles in Dior
entry.summary: CANNES, France (AP) - Natalie Portman is at home on the Cannes red carpet, but her appearance Saturday was her first as director as well as star.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: McConaughey, Van Sant film greeted harshly
entry.summary:
CANNES, France (AP) - Matthew McConaughey's remarkable comeback streak in recent years - the so called "McConaissance" - hit a bump at the Cannes Film Festival premiere of Gus Van Sant's "The Sea of Trees."

The film, about two men (McConaughey, Ken Watanabe) who find each other in a Japanese "suicide forest," was greeted harshly by critics and was loudly booed in its initial screenings to Cannes media.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Tom Hardy on wheels again in 'Mad Max'
entry.summary: In "Mad Max: Fury Road," which hit theaters this weekend after a wave of critical excitement and a glitzy premiere at the Cannes Film Festival, Hardy is again on the road.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Tom Hardy on wheels again in 'Mad Max'
entry.summary: CANNES, France (AP) - "Mad Max: Fury Road" is Tom Hardy's second film in two years to take place almost entirely on wheels.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Winehouse documentary shows fame's dark side
entry.summary: The sense that the singer foresaw her fate lends extra poignancy to the film, which is getting its world premiere at a Cannes midnight screening.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Winehouse documentary shows fame's dark side
entry.summary: CANNES, France (AP) - Celebrity-worshipping Cannes got a sobering reminder of fame's dark side Saturday with "Amy," a powerful documentary about the late singer Amy Winehouse.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Winehouse documentary shows fame's dark side
McConaughey's film booed at Cannes
Cannes Watch: Cheryl Fernandez-Versini is pretty in pink
entry.summary: Singer Cheryl Ann Fernandez-Versini waves to members of the public upon arrival for the screening of the film Irrational Man at the 68th international film festival, Cannes, southern France, Friday, May 15, 2015.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Man flouts no-selfie guidelines on red carpet
entry.summary: An unidentified person takes a selfie with actress Emma Stone, right, as they arrive for the screening of the film Irrational Man at the 68th international film festival, Cannes, southern France, Friday, May 15, 2015.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: A first time for Colin Farrell at Cannes
entry.summary: CANNES, France (AP) - Colin Farrell is no longer a Cannes Film Festival virgin.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: 'The Ghouls' ensemble enjoys fun camaraderie
entry.summary:
CANNES, France (AP) - The bond between the A-list stars of the new Chinese fantasy film "The Ghouls" clearly didn't stop when the group stopped filming.

Huang Bo, Chen Kun, Shu Qi, Angela Baby, and Xia Yu poked fun at one another as they promoted the film in Cannes this week.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Man flouts no-selfie guidelines on red carpet
entry.summary: CANNES, France (AP) - The organizers of the Cannes Film Festival aren't going to like these pictures.

entry.title: Rise of Netflix met warily at Cannes Film Festival
entry.summary:
Ted Sarandos, chief content officer of Netflix, appeared Friday as part of Cannes' NEXT conference to tout Netflix's global strategy and its desire to upend the traditional window release schedules of movies.

The confrontation illustrated the unease felt by some at the Cannes Film Festival about the encroachment of digital operators into an art form seen as hallowed in France, the birthplace of cinema.

Cannes is a place where a trailer for Quentin Tarantino's latest film, "Hateful Eight," drew applause when it advertises itself as shot "in glorious 70mm."

entry.title: Holocaust drama 'Son of Saul' shakes up Cannes audiences
entry.summary: CANNES, France (AP) - A Hungarian film that takes viewers into the hellish heart of the Holocaust has left Cannes reeling.

entry.title: Q&A: Reilly aims for European stardom with 3 films at Cannes
entry.summary:
CANNES, France (AP) - John C. Reilly has come to the Cannes Film Festival not just fashionably attired, but outfitted with three of the most adventurous films at the festival.

"When in Cannes," he says stretching out on a rooftop patio in a gleaming white suit, accessorized with a matching hat, two-tone leather brogues and a cane.

AP: This is your sixth time in Cannes.

When things are going well in Cannes, you feel like the world loves you.

entry.title: Charlie Hebdo documentary seeks buyers in Cannes
entry.summary: January's terrorist attack on the Paris offices of satirical magazine Charlie Hebdo continues to cast a shadow over France, and the Cannes Film Festival.

entry.title: Miranda flashes the flesh at Cannes
Cannes slips into high gear with Mad Max screening
entry.summary: The Cannes Film Festival slipped into high gear on its second day by screening the new Mad Max blockbuster and starting the competition for its Palme d'Or.

entry.title: Miranda flashes the flesh at Cannes
entry.summary: STARS bring the glamour at the 2015 Cannes Film Festival.

entry.title: Harvey Weinstein offers peek at 'Hateful Eight' at Cannes
entry.summary: The film was picked up by The Weinstein Company for U.S. distribution rights during the Cannes International Film Festival.

entry.title: Harvey Weinstein offers peek at 'Hateful Eight' at Cannes
entry.summary: One of the Cannes festival jury members, Jake Gyllenhaal, was also on hand to preview his boxing drama with director Antoine Fuqua: "Southpaw."

entry.title: Harvey Weinstein offers peek at 'Hateful Eight' at Cannes
entry.summary: CANNES, France (AP) " Harvey Weinstein offered a peek at Quentin Tarantino's film "The Hateful Eight" at the Cannes Film Festival on Thursday as the movie mogul previewed the Weinstein Co.'s upcoming slate.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Model says fashion moving slowly on diversity
entry.summary:
CANNES, France (AP) - Liya Kebede is one of the top models in fashion, but the Ethiopian stunner still sees the fashion industry as lagging when it comes to featuring people of color - and it's not the only one.

"Diversity is an issue - not just in fashion but in general, even in cinema. Especially when you're here, you also see it," Kebede, a L'Oreal ambassador for the Cannes Film Festival, said in an interview on Thursday.

"It was super exciting actually. I think we were all very nervous, I think it was kind of nerve-wracking, but Cannes is always full of magic and full of excitement and that red carpet is pretty special," she said.

entry.title: Cannes attendees debate dearth of female filmmakers
entry.summary: Bercot said she did not think her film had been chosen to open Cannes because she was a woman, and insisted female filmmakers are catching up to their male counterparts.

entry.title: Cannes attendees debate dearth of female filmmakers
entry.summary: Women are the talk of the Cannes Film Festival, where debate rages about why they are so plentiful in front of the camera and so scarce behind it.

entry.title: Amid male landscape of 'Mad Max,' Charlize Theron dominates
entry.summary: Charlize Theron pose for photographers during a photo call for the film Mad Max : Fury Road, at the 68th international film festival, Cannes, southern France, Thursday, May 14, 2015.

entry.summary: Critics mostly responded rapturously to its baroque weirdness at Cannes.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Salma Hayek eats Cannes' heart out
entry.summary: Hayek exclaimed Thursday morning after it showed for critics at the Cannes Film Festival.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Rossellini moved by Ingrid Bergman poster
entry.summary:
CANNES, France (AP) - Isabella Rossellini says it's a moving experience to see her late mother all over Cannes.

A giant version of the image towers over the famous red-carpeted steps of Cannes' Palais des Festivals.

Rossellini said she feels both honored and touched by the poster, and by a Cannes premiere for a documentary about Bergman, who died in 1982.

entry.title: Cannes dressing room glamour
entry.summary: AUSSIE actress Naomi Watts was joined by Victoria's Secret models as they prepared to hit the red carpet for the opening night of the Cannes film festival.

entry.title: Naomi Watts stuns at Cannes
entry.summary: The best looks at the Cannes FIlm Festival.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Watts into feathers; Coens not into TV
CANNES WATCH: Watts into feathers; Coens not into TV
entry.summary:
CANNES, France (AP) - Premieres, parties, pretty people and paparazzi.

EDITOR'S NOTE - "Cannes Watch" brings you the Cannes Film Festival and related events through the eyes and ears of AP reporters around Cannes and around the world.

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Naomi Watts resplendent in feathers
entry.summary: The flame-haired actress, who won Cannes' best-actress prize last year for "Maps to the Stars," offset the look with bold emerald earrings.

entry.title: Cannes Film Festival kicks off with a socially-minded tone
entry.summary: Joel and Ethan Coen, co-presidents of the Cannes jury this year, also presented their colleagues - including Jake Gyllenhaal, Guillermo del Toro and Sienna Miller - who will decide Cannes' prestigious Palme d'Or top prize.

entry.title: Cannes Film Festival kicks off with a socially-minded tone
entry.summary:
Some of the biggest directing names at this year's Cannes are on the jury.

Joel Coen, whose films have frequently premiered at Cannes, said the timing was perfect for him and his brother, who are waiting until February 2016 to release their next film, "Hail, Caesar!"

entry.title: CANNES WATCH: Deneuve sad at the death of glamour
entry.summary:
CANNES, France (AP) - French acting icon Catherine Deneuve is a cinema supernova.

Deneuve told reporters in Cannes Wednesday that glamour needs mystery, and that's hard to achieve now that social media has blurred the boundary between private and public.

Deneuve's message fits with the mood of a Cannes festival that is trying to eradicate selfies - another symbol of our oversharing age - from the red carpet.

entry.title: Cannes Film Festival kicks off with a socially-minded tone
entry.summary: Members of the media surround workers laying down the red carpet on the steps of the Palais des Festivals ahead of the 68th international film festival, Cannes, southern France, Wednesday, May 13, 2015.

entry.title: Cannes Film Festival kicks off with a socially-minded tone
entry.summary: Catherine Deneuve poses for photographers during a photo call for La Tete Haute (Standing Tall), at the 68th international film festival, Cannes, southern France, Wednesday, May 13, 2015.

entry.title: Cannes Film Festival kicks off with a more socially minded tone
entry.summary: Joel and Ethan Coen are presiding over the jury that will decide Cannes' prestigious Palme d'Or this year.

entry.title: Cannes kicks off with a more socially-minded tone
entry.summary: Directed by the French actress-filmmaker Emmanuelle Bercot, "Standing Tall" is only the second film directed by a woman to open Cannes, where the dearth of female filmmakers has sometimes been noted.

entry.title: Cannes kicks off with a more socially-minded tone
entry.summary: CANNES, France (AP) - The Cannes Film Festival unrolled its red carpet with a socially minded French drama, striking a more serious tone than the high dose of glamour the festival often opens with.

entry.title: Majestic meets 'Mad Max' in the maelstrom that's the Cannes film fest
entry.summary:
Huge, serene, majestic, the image of actress Ingrid Bergman floats like an ancient goddess over the secular chaos that is the Festival de Cannes.

The 19 slots in the Palme race this year have been reserved for current as well as potential auteurs, such as Hungary's Laszlo Nemes, whose Auschwitz-set "Son of Saul" is the only debut feature in Cannes' main event.

Directors native to other languages making films in competition in English is a bit of a mini-trend in Cannes this year.

Over at Quinzaine des Realisateurs (Directors' Fortnight), Cannes' determined crosstown rival (which snared Arnaud Desplechin's much-awaited "My Golden Years"), American cinema is represented by three films with Sundance connections.

entry.title: Cannes chief seeks sun, more female directors, fewer selfies
entry.summary: Moryba Konate, a worker from Ivory Coast, works to extend a beach during preparations ahead of the 68th international film festival, Cannes, southern France, Tuesday, May 12, 2015.

entry.title: Cannes chief seeks sun, more female directors, fewer selfies
entry.summary: Fremaux insists "it's not totally true" that women are underrepresented at Cannes.

entry.title: Cannes chief seeks sun, more female directors, fewer selfies
entry.summary: There are only two women among the 19 directors competing this year for Cannes' top prize, the Palme d'Or, although there are more among the scores of other films screening at the 12-day festival.

entry.title: Cannes chief seeks sun, more female directors, fewer selfies
entry.summary: CANNES, France (AP) - As the Cannes Film Festival gets set to open, two trends seem clear: The women are coming - and the selfies are going.

entry.summary: "I could not convince him. I called him and all I got was a sneer," said Fremeaux of Allen, who also was out of competition with his last Cannes offering, "Midnight in Paris", in 2011.

entry.title: Jia, Sorrentino, Van Sant in Cannes lineup; selfies a no-no

entry.title: 2015 Cannes Film Festival lineup announced
entry.summary:
Palme d'Or laureate Gus Van Sant's "The Sea of Trees" and Justin Kurzel's "Macbeth" will jazz up the 68th Cannes festival, the glittering cinema showcase to which Woody Allen returns after a three-year hiatus.

Van Sant won Cannes's highest distinction, the Palme d'Or for the best movie, in 2003 with "Elephant."

entry.title: Cannes unveils 2015 official selection lineup
entry.summary:
Only 17 films were announced for competition and 14 in Un Certain Regard, both lower than the likely eventual totals, and Cannes delegate general Thierry Fremaux assured those in attendance that more pictures would be added to the lineup in the coming days.

Kore-eda received a jury prize and an ecumenical prize at Cannes just two years ago for "Like Father, Like Son," and he was also in competition with "Nobody Knows" (2004) and "Distance" (2001).

Maiwenn was previously at Cannes with her ensemble drama "Polisse" (2011), which won a jury prize.

The filmmaker has had three prior films in competition at Cannes: "Unknown Pleasures" (2002), "24 City" (2008) and "A Touch of Sin" (2013), which won a screenplay prize.

Docter was previously in Cannes with "Up," the first animated film ever to open the festival.

entry.title: Jia, Sorrentino, Van Sant in Cannes festival lineup
entry.summary: Cannes International Film Festival poster for the upcoming 68th edition featuring Swedish actress Ingrid Bergman, is set up, in Paris, France, Thursday, April 16, 2015.

entry.title: Jia, Sorrentino, Van Sant in Cannes festival lineup
entry.summary:
Cannes Film festival President Pierre Lescure, left, and festival general delegate Thierry Fremaux, give a press conference to announce this year's line up, in Paris, France, Tuesday, April 16, 2015.

Announcing the festival lineup Thursday, Cannes director Thierry Fremaux called selfies "ridiculous and grotesque."

entry.title: 'La Tete Haute' to open Cannes Film Festival
entry.summary: Cannes runs May 13-24.

entry.title: 'La Tete Haute' to open Cannes Film Festival
entry.summary:
NEW YORK (AP) - For the first time, a female director will kick off the Cannes Film Festival.

The festival announced Monday that "La Tete Haute," a French drama directed by Emmanuelle Bercot, will open the 68th Cannes Film Festival on May 13.

entry.title: 'La Tete Haute' to open Cannes Film Festival
entry.summary: Cannes head Thierry Fremaux said the choice "is a clear reflection of our desire to see the festival start with a different piece, which is both bold and moving."

entry.title: Turkish Cannes winner joins fight against domestic censorship
entry.summary: Last year Ceylan won two prizes at Cannes, making him one of Turkish cinema's most decorated directors.

entry.title: Cannes Film Festival Opening With Female-Directed Film for First Time Ever
entry.summary: "The choice of this film may seem surprising, given the rules generally applied to the Festival de Cannes Opening Ceremony," Thierry Fremaux, general delegate of the event, said.

entry.title: Isabella Rossellini to head Cannes' Un Certain Regard jury
entry.summary: The festival said Friday she will also attend a Cannes screening of a documentary about her mother.

entry.title: Isabella Rossellini to head Cannes' Un Certain Regard jury
entry.summary: PARIS (AP) - The Cannes Film Festival says Italian-American actress Isabella Rossellini will head the jury for its sidebar competition, Un Certain Regard.

entry.summary: The 68th Cannes Film Festival will take place between May 13 and 24, with US filmmakers Joel and Ethan Cohen presiding over the jury.
